str2: This here, this, that, he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To sit down beside, set beside. From para and kathizo; to sit down near.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
